page.title: 05LIFE IN DAVIOT AROUND 1920
page.content: Balvonie, Daviot, By Inverness, 16/6/1985 Dear Joanne and David, I am writing to tell you about life in the 1920's. When I was in school the teachers were called Mrs Macintosh and Miss Fraser.There were about sixty children and some of them were orphans.I wore a kilt to school.At the age of thirteen I left school.I went to the Inverness High school on my bike which was a James. The A9 (the main road in Daviot) has changed the village in the way that people thought that it would go right through the village, but instead it goes behind the church. Every Tuesday my father went into town in his Morris Cowley.
